About.title: Little about me
About.p1: Hi there! ðŸ˜Š I'm Antoine and I absolutely love creating content as a hobby. While I haven't had the chance to work independently for clients just yet, I'm really looking forward to that opportunity. I'm 29 years old and proud to call Montreal, Canada my home (and yes, I speak French!).
About.p2: Back in school, I was super passionate about sports and even dreamed of going pro. However, as time went on, I realized my true calling was in entrepreneurship.
About.p3: My journey into web development began during one of my internships, and here I am today, still completely enamored with it. Currently, I'm a frontend developer at {company}, where I face new challenges every week. I take immense pride and joy in the work I doâ€”it's truly fulfilling!

Introduction.name: Antoine Hakim
Introduction.summary: I'm a full-stack developer with background experience in building complex platforms and design.

Design.title: Design
Design.a: A figma design with of how your website will look like
Design.b: Unlimited calls to go over your design

SinglePage.title: One page
SinglePage.a: Could be a portfolio to showcase your skills
SinglePage.b: Could be a blog page that will allow you to post content about your favorite subjects
SinglePage.d: Could be an event promotion website

Custom.title: Custom
Custom.e: Will include SEO (Search engine Optimization) to index your website amongst the first results

Resume.Role: Experienced full-stack engineer focused on building accessible & custom experience

GoTo.summary: I contribute to the development of a top-notch SaaS business communication tool, focusing on customer-facing features. My work ensures the platform remains high quality and robust, delivering a seamless experience for users.
GoTo.a: Developed a high-end business communication settings tool using ReactJS, Redux-Thunk, React-Router, Javascript, Typescript, HTML5, CSS3, and MUI5
GoTo.b: Built and managed custom components for internal libraries, including custom Formik input/select/radio fields
GoTo.c: Exclusively used React-Hooks to handle application life-cycle processes
GoTo.d: Collaborated with the UI/UX team to establish specifications and system designs
GoTo.e: Worked in Agile Methodologies for iterative development to consistently deliver a better application
GoTo.f: Possesses strong expertise in Github (formerly used Bitbucket) as the main version control service
GoTo.g: Created features/sections/subsections for the new web app (coded in React) using a micro frontend approach
GoTo.h: Developed features that facilitated a smooth transition for 90% of clients using the legacy platform web app to the more modern web app, resulting in a significantly improved user experience

Desjardins.summary: Contributed to the development of a secured messaging platform for internal use with outside customer, where both parties can share documents, send and receive messages alongside other features. Working there also gave me hands-on experience with security management since it was a bank, and information is extremely sensitive. The backend worked as a microservice approach and I was responsible for one of them, therefore I learned to develop a REST backend with SpringBoot and a lot of experience with pipeline deployment.
Desjardins.a: Led the development and introduced rigorous coding standards for our frontend application in Typescript using StencilJS
Desjardins.b: Developed a frontend service from scratch using AngularJS, StencilJS, Typescript, HTML5, and CSS/SCSS
Desjardins.c: Helped develop a RESTful service from scratch, using a microservices approach for better performance with the help of SpringBoot and libraries such as PKCE for secure authentication
Desjardins.d: Configured Concourse/CI automated pipelines that would fetch a project, build, run unit tests, run smoke tests, and deploy to multiple environments (dev, stage and production)
Desjardins.e: Developed unit tests using JUnit5 and JaCoCo for Spring Boot, and Jest for Stencil
Desjardins.f: Connected our repositories to our dedicated SonarQube server, and added an 80% coverage test with 5% duplication thresholds for success (on both backend and frontend)

Bell.summary: Led the development of a fully functional JIRA-like dashboard helping internal employees with their morning stand-ups. My work impacted their schedules and allowed them to be 70% more productive everyday. I took charge in setting up the code structure and using what I had at the time, very small knowledge of EmberJS. I also had the chance to work on the REST backend which was developed in C#.
Bell.a: Built a fully functional JIRA-like dashboard for internal teams to use at standups from scratch using EmberJS, and the Ember Octane framework, along with HTML, JavaScript, and CSS
Bell.b: Introduced a solid structured code design that creates reusable modular components across the app
Bell.c: Mentored interns on the use of EmberJS
Bell.d: Worked with the backend team to develop endpoints for specific use cases required by the clients using C# with some well-known design patterns such as OOP and Polymorphism
Bell.e: Followed agile development practices and used Bitbucket/JIRA for bug tracking

Discord.summary: I developed a discord bot with a music queue functionality, for my friends and I.
Discord.a: Developed a Discord Bot that plays music for my group of friends using NodeJS, incorporating a custom-made queue system with features like previous, pause, play, and next. This implementation utilized prebuilt libraries such as Discord.js 13 and ytdl for playing Youtube music
Discord.b: Configured an EC2 server instance to host my Discord bot using a prebuilt library package called pm2, which effectively runs Node projects as processes, enabling the bot to operate 24/7
Discord.c: Pursued Ansible and Terraform as hobbies to acquire automation skills, successfully automating the process of setting up an EC2 server with all the necessary packages to run the Discord bot

Pickside.summary: Pickside is an app that is still in development. It aims to be a platform where people can plan sporting events on outdoor/indoor fields, find teams and groups to play with.
Pickside.a: Developed a sporting event manager web app that allows users to plan outdoor activities related to sports using ReactJS, Redux-Thunk, TailwindCSS, and HTML
Pickside.b: Created a RESTful service backend using NodeJS/ExpressJS and Mongoose, which connects to a MongoDB server for data storage
Pickside.c: Implemented an authentication system with the help of the JWT library, allowing users to connect to the backend with an accessToken (currently lasting 1 minute) and a refreshToken
Pickside.d: Integrated a Swagger server to host the same endpoint for documentation purposes
Pickside.e: Implemented a Google login authentication option, allowing users to connect with their Google accounts
Pickside.f: Created custom-made reusable components such as TextField, Accordion, Stepper, Toast, Calendar, and Timepicker
Pickside.g: Exclusively utilized React-Hooks to handle application life-cycle processes
Pickside.h: Developed custom middlewares to intercept dispatches and execute some logic
Pickside.i: Utilized Google's Places library to connect a map and search for locations
Pickside.j: Used HTML's native geolocating function to ask for the user's location, so the map centers and zooms in on their area upon loading
Pickside.k: Implemented a language switcher and a theme switcher

PortfolioV1.summary: First version of my personal portfolio developed in React without typescript.
PortfolioV1.a: Developed a portfolio/profile website with no backend, utilizing React 18 and TailwindCSS
PortfolioV1.b: Designed and implemented custom-made components such as Dialogs, Buttons, LanguageSwitchers, and Spinners
PortfolioV1.c: Implemented a small contact form that allows visitors to reach out via Email using the EmailJS library
PortfolioV1.d: Integrated a language switcher (FR, EN) using i18next for improved user experience
PortfolioV1.e: Implemeted a PDF download option for my curriculum that supports both languages
PortfolioV1.f: Set up an S3 bucket to statically host this project under a purchased domain, ensuring secure HTTPS protocol
PortfolioV1.g: Gained a comprehensive understanding of using aws-cli commands

PortfolioV2.summary: This is a second version of my portfolio developed with NextJS with typescript.
PortfolioV2.a: Developed a portfolio/profile website with no backend, utilizing React 18 and TailwindCSS
PortfolioV2.b: Designed and implemented custom-made components such as Dialogs, Buttons, LanguageSwitchers, and Spinners
PortfolioV2.c: Implemented a small contact form that allows visitors to reach out via Email using the EmailJS library
PortfolioV2.d: Integrated a language switcher (FR, EN) using i18next for improved user experience
PortfolioV2.e: Implemeted a PDF download option for my curriculum that supports both languages
PortfolioV2.f: Set up an S3 bucket to statically host this project under a purchased domain, ensuring secure HTTPS protocol
PortfolioV2.g: Gained a comprehensive understanding of using aws-cli commands

Sadbois.summary: This project is my first ever introduction to React. It was supposed to be an online store with for selling merchandise but the project never finished.
Sadbois.a: Developed a very small E-Commerce website as a project for friends, although it was never completed. The development involved using React, Redux-Thunk, HTML, CSS, and SCSS
Sadbois.b: Implemented a fully functional cart system, a basic login system, and a semi-functional PayPal integration for processing payments
Sadbois.c: Created a backend REST service that seamlessly connects to a SQL database system
Sadbois.d: Set up migration files to facilitate data initialization during fresh runs, specifically for development purposes
